_comment: Created by ianb on 21/07/2014 16:45:26 using v2.1
title: How strongly do seasons influence breaches?
analysis_commentary: The impact of "winter pressures" on A&E performance against the four-hour target have been the subject of some debate. This chart shows weekly performance for major A&E units indexed to the start of the calendar year - so week 1 to 4 are January, weeks 5 to 8 are February and so on. There is a general trend for performance to be higher in the summer - despite the fact that A&E sees the highest numbers of attendees at this time. This is explained by changes in the case-mix of people attending. In summer A&E sees a higher proportion of cuts and sprains, most of which can be treated relatively quickly. A large dip in performance can be seen in the first 18 weeks of 2013. Performance trends appear more consistent towards the second-half of the year, although the 2014 data has yet to join the established trend.
data_source: NHS England, A&E Waiting Times and Activity
